prompt: what is the S-3 API to upload a file to AWS?
orig_response: The S3 API (Simple Storage Service API) is a web service interface provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS) that allows users to store and retrieve any amount of data at any time from anywhere on the web. To upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API, you typically use the `PutObject` operation, which requires specifying the target bucket name and the key (file name) for the object being uploaded. You can also include metadata and set permissions for the object. The file can be uploaded directly as part of the request, or you can use a pre-signed URL for secure uploads. Additionally, AWS SDKs for various programming languages simplify the process by providing higher-level abstractions for file uploads, handling authentication, and managing connections to the S3 service.

revised_fact_jsonified_all.revised_unit: The Simple Storage Service API (S3 API) is a web service interface.
The S3 API (Simple Storage Service API) is provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS).
The Simple Storage Service API allows users to store data.
The S3 API (Simple Storage Service API) allows users to store any amount of data.
The Simple Storage Service API allows users to store data at any time.
The Simple Storage Service API allows users to store data from anywhere on the web.
The Simple Storage Service API allows users to retrieve data.
The S3 API (Simple Storage Service API) allows users to retrieve any amount of data.
The Simple Storage Service API allows users to retrieve data at any time.
The S3 API (Simple Storage Service API) allows users to retrieve data from anywhere on the web.
The Simple Storage Service API is used to upload a file to Amazon Web Services Simple Storage Service.
The `PutObject` operation is used to upload a file to AWS S3 using the Simple Storage Service API.
The `PutObject` operation used to upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API requires specifying the target bucket name.
The `PutObject` operation requires specifying the key (file name) for the object being uploaded to AWS S3.
The key (file name) is the file name for the file being uploaded.
The user who is uploading a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API can include metadata.
The user of the S3 API can set permissions for the object being uploaded using the `PutObject` operation.
Metadata can be included for the object being uploaded to AWS S3 using the `PutObject` operation.
Permissions can be set for the object being uploaded to AWS S3.
The file being uploaded to AWS S3 using the S3 API can be uploaded directly as part of the request for the `PutObject` operation.
The file that can be uploaded to AWS S3 using the S3 API can be uploaded using a pre-signed URL.
A pre-signed URL for secure uploads to AWS S3 using the S3 API can be used for secure uploads to AWS S3 using the S3 API.
AWS SDKs for various programming languages simplify the file upload process to AWS S3 using the S3 API.
Amazon Web Services SDKs are available for various programming languages.
AWS SDKs for various programming languages provide higher-level abstractions for file uploads.
AWS SDKs for various programming languages handle authentication.
AWS SDKs for various programming languages manage connections to the S3 API (Simple Storage Service API).
